2025-08-01.history: St. Alphonsus (1696–1787) was a bishop, doctor of the Church, and founder of the Redemptorists. He is known for his moral theology and Marian devotion.

2025-08-02.saint: St. Eusebius of Vercelli & St. Peter Julian Eymard
2025-08-02.history: St. Eusebius (d. 371) defended the Nicene faith against Arianism. St. Peter Julian Eymard (1811–1868) founded the Congregation of the Blessed Sacrament.

2025-08-03.history: Ordinary Time Sundays draw from the Gospel to deepen discipleship. Today recalls Christ as the Bread of Life.

2025-08-04.history: St. John Vianney (1786–1859), the Curé of Ars, was a French parish priest known for his holiness and pastoral zeal.

2025-08-05.saint: Dedication of the Basilica of St. Mary Major
2025-08-05.history: This basilica in Rome, dedicated after the Council of Ephesus (431), honors Mary as Mother of God.

2025-08-06.history: The Transfiguration reveals Christ’s divine glory on Mount Tabor before Peter, James, and John.

2025-08-07.saint: St. Sixtus II & Companions, Martyrs; St. Cajetan
2025-08-07.history: Pope Sixtus II and his companions were martyred under Valerian in 258. St. Cajetan (1480–1547) co-founded the Theatines.

2025-08-08.history: St. Dominic (1170–1221) founded the Order of Preachers (Dominicans), emphasizing study and preaching.

2025-08-09.saint: St. Teresa Benedicta of the Cross (Edith Stein), Martyr
2025-08-09.history: A Jewish convert, Carmelite nun, philosopher, and martyr at Auschwitz (1942). Canonized in 1998.

2025-08-10.history: Lawrence, a Roman deacon, was martyred in 258. His courage and service to the poor are legendary.

2025-08-11.history: St. Clare (1193–1253) was the first female follower of St. Francis, founder of the Poor Clares.

2025-08-12.history: Founder of the Visitation Order with St. Francis de Sales; lived a life of deep prayer and charity.

2025-08-13.history: Pope Pontian (d. 235) and Hippolytus were exiled and martyred together in Sardinia.

2025-08-14.history: A Polish Franciscan (1894–1941), Kolbe gave his life at Auschwitz in place of another prisoner.

2025-08-15.saint: Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary
2025-08-15.history: Celebrates Mary’s assumption body and soul into heavenly glory.

2025-08-16.history: King Stephen (975–1038) established Christianity in Hungary and was canonized in 1083.

2025-08-17.history: This Sunday’s Gospel reminds us of faith’s persistence, as shown in the Canaanite woman.

2025-08-18.history: Ordinary Time weekdays offer space for reflection on Christ’s teaching in daily life.

2025-08-19.history: French priest (1601–1680), founder of the Congregation of Jesus and Mary, promoter of devotion to the Sacred Hearts.

2025-08-20.history: Bernard (1090–1153), Cistercian abbot, was a great preacher, mystic, and reformer.

2025-08-21.history: Pope Pius X (1835–1914) promoted frequent communion and reformed Church liturgy.

2025-08-22.saint: Queenship of the Blessed Virgin Mary
2025-08-22.history: Instituted by Pope Pius XII (1954), this feast honors Mary as Queen of Heaven and Earth.

2025-08-23.history: St. Rose (1586–1617), first canonized saint of the Americas, lived a life of penance and prayer in Peru.

2025-08-24.history: Bartholomew (Nathanael in John’s Gospel) was one of the Twelve Apostles, known for his simple faith.

2025-08-25.saint: St. Louis of France; St. Joseph Calasanz
2025-08-25.history: King Louis IX (1214–1270) was a model Christian ruler. St. Joseph Calasanz (1557–1648) founded the Piarists.

2025-08-26.history: Ordinary Time continues the Gospel journey with Christ in daily life.

2025-08-27.history: St. Monica (331–387), mother of St. Augustine, is remembered for her patience and persistent prayer.

2025-08-28.history: St. Augustine (354–430) was Bishop of Hippo, a brilliant theologian, and one of the greatest Fathers of the Church.

2025-08-29.saint: Passion of St. John the Baptist
2025-08-29.history: This day commemorates the martyrdom of John the Baptist, who bore fearless witness to the truth.

2025-08-30.history: Ordinary Time provides space to reflect on Christ’s teachings in ordinary life.

2025-08-31.history: This Sunday’s Gospel calls us to humility and self-sacrifice in following Christ.
